trustfund:
TF025491-PHRD-TAX ADMIN.TECH.ASSIST.PROJ.,TF040703-LATIN AMERICA:FINANCIAL
            MANAGEMENT OF PUBLIC SECTOR MODERNIZATION

abstracts.cdata!:
The Second Integrated Financial
            Management Project for Guatemala had a satisfactory outcome
            with highly likely sustainability, substantial institutional
            development impact, and satisfactory performances by both
            the Bank and the Borrower. Major Factors which affected
            implementation and outcome: a) outside factors -
            technological change and computer security; b) factors
            subject to government control - government commitment, staff
            turnover at the line ministries, and staff continuity within
            the PCU; c) factor subject to implementing agency control -
            delays in system integration.  Lessons learned include the
            following.  Achieving project objectives was directly
            related to the level of government commitment.  Using
            widely-available and appropriate technologies.  Developing
            capacity among all participating entities to achieve results
            throughout the entire system.  Institutional flexibility is
            needed to continuously update technology.
